instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message:
BOARD DEAD
<TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR>  SHORTED TO GROUND
I CHANGED WITH AON7934 (<TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> WAS SiZ342DT) BOTH DUAL N CHANNEL
SHORT CLEARED. 
NOW AM GETTING ONLY  1.3VOLT AT FUSE F7000.

WHAT MAY BE THE ISSUE
IS BAD CHARGING IC OR  WRONG MOSFET ?
PLEASE HELP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message:
Please, stop to write entire message in capital letters.
Is (scientifically demonstrated) more difficult to read, than normal writing.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> has more than 1 pin; which was shorted to ground (apart of 5-7)?
Is more convenient to specify a rail/line/pin, instead of a component; avoid missunderstood, please.

Do you now get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
If yes, post basic <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>#, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.
Also check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message:
First of all sorry.
No <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> no other legs shorted to ground
It's internally shorted.
The short cleared by replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR>

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has high resistance arround 1300,
 it goes high ohm in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltages;
PP <SIGNAL>DCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> = 5 VOLT
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 1.1VOLT
VDDA/P = 5VOLT
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL>=0 VOLT
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL># NOT FOUND
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> NOT FOUND
A/BMON= 0VOLT
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> = 0VOLT

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL># NOT FOUND
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> NOT FOUND"
Sorry, forgot this T2 board makes different use of some <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> signals.

Is still not clear which <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> lines did you find shorted to ground!
Just in case, test replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR>'S 5,6,7 legs are GND
and 2,3,4 are <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL>
its totally shorted so <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground before changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR>
after replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> , F7000 gets high resistance to ground.
I changed both  <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> with same (AON7934)
but still only 1volt at F7000.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD
threads.message: If all R/C/7030/40 are good, change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
